## GAD-7 vs DMQ

GAD-7 vs DMQ: An Essential Comparison For Psychologists The need for harmonising various questionnaire items like those in GAD-7 and DMQ is essential for psychologists and social scientists. Traditionally, this has been a subjective and time-consuming process, however, the innovative software, Harmony, is designed to simplify this procedure considerably. GAD-7 vs DMQ is a comparison that can now be done quickly and efficiently, thanks to Harmony. The Generalised Anxiety Disorder Assessment (GAD-7) and Drinking Motives Questionnaire (DMQ) although cater to different research aspects, have potential overlaps that psychologists might wish to streamline. Harmony, a tool designed specifically for such purposes, uses natural language processing and AI to bridge the gap of different questionnaires in a harmonious manner, even in different languages. It provides a percentage match between each item in GAD-7 vs DMQ, thus illuminating the similarities and differences between these two influential psychological tools. Using Harmony to undertake comparisons, such as GAD-7 vs DMQ, will save psychologists valuable time, while also ensuring the accurate matching of questionnaire items. The user-friendly web interface allows you to select tools from a curated list or to upload your own. Harmony's multilingual capabilities ensure global applicability and universal accessibility. We highly recommend that psychologists utilize the astute software of Harmony to conduct their GAD-7 vs DMQ comparisons and see how it revolutionises their research process.

## Compare the items in GAD-7 English and DMQ

* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import GAD-7 and DMQ into Harmony and harmonise them</a> - find similarities between the two instruments using our AI platform
* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import just GAD-7 into Harmony</a> - compare GAD-7 English with other instruments
* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import just DMQ into Harmony</a> - compare DMQ with other instruments


## Questions in GAD-7

|   No. | GAD-7 English                                                                                                                                      |
|------:|:---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
|     1 | Feeling nervous, anxious, or on edge                                                                                                               |
|     2 | Not being able to stop or control worrying                                                                                                         |
|     3 | Worrying too much about different things                                                                                                           |
|     4 | Trouble relaxing                                                                                                                                   |
|     5 | Being so restless that it is hard to sit still                                                                                                     |
|     6 | Becoming easily annoyed or irritable                                                                                                               |
|     7 | Feeling afraid, as if something awful might happen                                                                                                 |
|     8 | If you checked any problems, how difficult have they made it for you to do your work, take care of things at home, or get along with other people? |
